metadata.Title: CVE-2016-9190 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Pillow before 3.3.2 allows context-dependent attackers to execute arbitrarycode by using the "crafted image file" approach, related to an "InsecureSign Extension" issue affecting the ImagingNew in Storage.c component.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9190` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-imaging - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3.4
python-imaging-compat - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3.4
python-imaging-sane - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3.4
python-imaging-tk - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3.4
python-pil - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3.4
python-pil.imagetk - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3.4
python-sane - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3.4
python3-imaging - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3.4
python3-imaging-sane - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3.4
python3-imaging-tk - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3.4
python3-pil - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3.4
python3-pil.imagetk - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3.4
python3-sane - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3.4
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: pillow package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.3.0-1ubuntu3.4').
